properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 2:36PM MST until January 13 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...

.Snow will begin across east-central Oregon and the mountains
of west-central Idaho tonight as the first in a series of low
pressure systems impacts the region. The mountains will see
periods of heavy snow through at least Tuesday as three separate
storm systems track through the Pacific Northwest. Valleys will
see periods of snow through Tuesday with accumulating snow
becoming more likely into early next week.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, late tonight through
Sunday night, total snow accumulations up to 5 inches, except
up to 8 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35
mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, Monday afternoon and Monday
night, snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible.

* WHERE...Harney County and Malheur County zones.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, late tonight through
Sunday night.  The Winter Storm Watch will extend from Monday
afternoon through late Monday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MST /11 PM PST/ SATURDAY NIGHT TO 6 AM MST /5 AM PST/ MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
